prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Normalize counts, make two PCA plots for samples, one color coded samples by "group" and the other color coded by "LibrarySelection" in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
```
# Load necessary libraries
library(data.table)
library(readxl)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggfortify)

# Read in count table and annotation data
count_table <- as.data.frame(read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx"))
annotation_data <- fread("SRP021193.colData.tsv")

# Remove any missing values in count table
count_table <- count_table[complete.cases(count_table), ]

# Set row names as gene names
rownames(count_table) <- count_table$Genes

# Remove gene names as a separate column
count_table <- count_table[,-1]

# Normalize counts using DESeq2 method
normalized_counts <- count_table / colSums(count_table) * 1e6

# Create a data frame with sample IDs, group, and LibrarySelection
sample_data <- annotation_data[, .(sample_id = V1, group = V2, LibrarySelection = V4)]

# Join the count table and sample data based on sample IDs
normalized_counts <- cbind.data.frame(sample_id = rownames(normalized_counts), normalized_counts)
normalized_counts <- merge(normalized_counts, sample_data, by = "sample_id")

# Perform PCA using normalized counts
pca <- prcomp(normalized_counts[, -1], scale. = TRUE)

# Plot PCA with samples color-coded by "group"
ggplot(data = normalized_counts, aes(x = pca$x[,1], y = pca$x[,2], color = group)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "PC1", y = "PC2") +
  ggtitle("PCA Plot: Samples Colored by Group") +
  theme_minimal()

# Plot PCA with samples color-coded by "LibrarySelection"
ggplot(data = normalized_counts, aes(x = pca$x[,1], y = pca$x[,2], color = LibrarySelection)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "PC1", y = "PC2") +
  ggtitle("PCA Plot: Samples Colored by LibrarySelection") +
  theme_minimal()
}
```
